node.title: Kerr, Foord score in Champions League but other Aussies not as lucky
node.description: Matildas forwards Sam Kerr and Caitlin Foord continue their European goal-scoring form while Aussie team-mates suffer a different fate in the group stage.
node.content: ["Matildas captain Sam Kerr has taken her\u00a0Champions League goal-scoring tally to four in four games this season,\u00a0less than a week after signing a two-year contract extension with the reigning Women's Super League champions.", "Kerr scored the club's only goal in their second-leg 1-0 win over Swiss side Servette, home to fellow Australian Tessa Tamplin, in match day four of the Champions League group stage on Friday morning, Australian time.", "The win cements Chelsea in top spot of Group A, three points ahead of second-placed Juventus, coached by Aussie Joe Montemurro.", "In early December, the two sides will meet as the group stage \u2014\u00a0the first time the women's competition has included one \u2014\u00a0winds down.", "Friday's second-leg game was an impressive response by the Swiss champions, who were demolished by Chelsea, 7-0, earlier this month.", "While Chelsea were characteristically dominant \u2014\u00a0outshooting their opponents 21 to 6 while maintaining over 70% possession \u2014\u00a0Servette's\u00a0determined and disciplined defending\u00a0kept the Blues to 0-0\u00a0until half-time.", "However, the unstoppable combination of Fran Kirby and Sam Kerr opened them up in the 67th minute and\u00a0the Matildas skipper finished neatly inside the far post.", "To make matters worse for the debutantes, defender Amandine Soulard received a red card in the 82nd minute, taking her out of Servette's clash with Wolfsburg next month.", "The German club lost to Juventus, 2-0, in the group's other match on Friday.", "Elsewhere in the Champions League, Kerr's Matildas teammate, Caitlin Foord, scored the\u00a0second European goal of her career on Thursday morning as Arsenal defeated\u00a0Danish side HB\u00a0K\u00f8ge, 3-0.", "Foord opened the scoring in the 15th minute, tapping home a pin-point Beth Mead cross, before defender Lotte Wubben-Moy and Netherlands striker Vivianne Miedema sealed the win in the final 10\u00a0minutes.", "Matildas goalkeeper Lydia Williams also started for Arsenal, while Steph Catley was substituted on just after the hour.", "The result takes the Gunners up to second\u00a0in Group C, two points behind the defending champions, Barcelona, who they will face on December 10.", "Barcelona eased past Hoffenheim, 5-0, in their second-leg match yesterday.", "Fortunes weren't in every Australian's favour, though, with Ellie Carpenter's Lyon losing, 1-0, to German giants Bayern Munich.", "Former Lyon defender and Japan veteran Saki Kumagai scored the winner after the French side took out the first leg 2-1.", "Lyon are now just two points ahead of Bayern at the top of Group D with two match days left.", "The other Group D match saw Dylan Holmes' BK H\u00e4cken lose, 2-1, to Benfica, with Holmes an unused substitute.", "Rounding out the competition, French champions PSG defeated Real Madrid, 2-0, taking them six points clear at the top of Group B, while Ukranian club\u00a0Zhytlobud-1 defeated Iceland's Breidablik, 2-0."]
